Título: TIME TOO LONG TO DROP THE HEAD LUBRICATION PRESSURE.
Descripción: The pressure switch G10-B19, that checks the pressure of the head lubrication circuit, keeps detecting pressure. NOTE: we recommend to replace the filters periodically.

Preguntas.Texto: 1. When the pump stops, the pressure has to drop to 0 bar. When the pump G10-M31 stops, does the pressure drops to 0 bar?

Respuestas.Texto: It drops too low or it doesn't drop at all.
Yes, it drops as showed in the video.

Preguntas.Texto: 1.1. Check the internal circuit of the pump (clean and replace the filters). Does the alarm dissappear?
1.2. Check the setting of the pressure switch  to 20 bar.

Respuestas.Mensaje: Adjust the setting to 20 bar and repeat this point #1 again.

Preguntas.Texto: 2. Release the pressure pipe, at the entrance of the pump and check that the PLC input (E458) changes to 0.

Respuestas.Mensaje: The pressure drops too low. Clean filters and/or replace the whoe pump.
Check the functionality of the pressure switch and the wiring from this unit to the electrical cabinet. If everything looks right, replace the presure switch.
